Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2007 10:30AM carol_sister wrote: Hi Heather, When I had my abnormal mammo the next step was a stereotactic biopsy because there was no palpable lump. This was done by a radiologist. If there's a lump, a breast surgeon can do a quicker needle biopsy. Both are done under a local anesthetic. Do find the best comprehensive breast center in your area that your insurance covers, and have the diagnostic tests done there by a breast surgeon. It might affect your prognosis, and is likely to affect your treatment options.
Posts.Title: Who Should I Be Seeing? Heather_Hu SandyinSoCal
